text: hello this is chef tom from food wishes
comm with a little bit of a tease this
is not really a video recipe this is my
cousin Tony's sausage recipe and I was
kind of busy going in and out of the
kitchen
so I filmed parts of it but it's gonna
inspire me to actually do a sausage
video for you all
using Tony's equipment this is pork
shoulder spices salt and the makin
sausage at home is really not that hard
now I want all you young cooks to notice
Tony
toasting his spices first a huge
difference using whole coriander and
fennel toasting them in a dry pan till
you can kind of smell the oils coming
out and then you grind them Tony's going
old-school here he's just a mortar and
pestle and you're just gonna crush those
herbs the new style for you young cooks
is wearing the towel kind of like a
loincloth so anyway a little fashion
update there and he's gonna crush that
spice and add it to the sausage mixture
he's gonna pick some fresh herb he's
already got some basil in there I think
that was some oregano I make a much
better chef than photographer because
he's chopping the oregano I'm filming
the bowl shake back and forth
which you know it's kind of
scintillating video I think alright so
there we go so now what he's gonna do is
gonna mix that up he also added some red
wine vinegar some people use just
regular wine should have a little bit of
liquid in there ice water sometimes is
used and then he's gonna feed all that
seasoned pork shoulder into his
KitchenAid with the sausage attachment
the meat grinder attachment and here of
course is my favorite shot the
gratuitous ground me coming out of the
front of the grinder there so once you
grind it usually you use a coarse grind
and there's a little plunger to push it
through then you're gonna find some
casing alright and I cannot confirm or
deny that that's actually the intestines
of an animal but most butcher shops meat
stores are gonna sell casing and there
you go you stuff it you tie it off and
you have homemade sausage so stay tuned
for that I'm gonna make that one of
these days thanks for the tease Tony and
check out the site if you're not already
there and as always enjoy
you
